org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.index

Interface DocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IndexManagerBackend
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend, ChunkDbIndexManagerBackend, DocumentBasedChunkIndex, InMemoryIndexManagerBackend, JdbcIndexManagerBackend, MapDBIndexManagerBackend, TuplIndexManagerBackend

    public interface DocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
extends IndexManagerBackend
    An IndexManagerBackend that uses the concept of index documents.

    The basic idea of this kind of indexing comes from Apache Lucene. The document analogy was adapted for ChronoDB indexing.

    • Method Detail

      • deleteAllIndexContents

        void deleteAllIndexContents()
        Deletes the contents of all indices.

        The indexers themselves are unaffected by this method.

      • deleteIndexContents

        void deleteIndexContents(java.lang.String indexName)
        Deletes the contents of the index with the given name.
        Parameters:
        indexName - The name of the index to delete the contents for. Must not be null.

      • applyModifications

        void applyModifications(ChronoIndexModifications indexModifications)
        Applies the given index modifications to this index.
        Parameters:
        indexModifications - The index modifications to apply. Must not be null.

      • getMatchingDocuments

        java.util.Collection<ChronoIndexDocument> getMatchingDocuments(long timestamp,
                                                               Branch branch,
                                                               java.lang.String keyspace,
                                                               SearchSpecification<?> searchSpec)
        Returns the set of ChronoIndexDocuments that match the given search specification at the given timestamp, in the given branch.

        This method also searches through the origin branches (recursively). It returns only the most recent documents (up to and including the given timestamp).

        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp up to which the documents should be searched. Must not be negative.
        branch - The branch in which to start the search. Origin branches will be searched as well (recursively). Must not be null.
        keyspace - The keyspace to search in. Must not be null.
        searchSpec - The search specification to fulfill. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The set of documents that match the given search criteria. May be empty, but never null.

      • getMatchingBranchLocalDocuments

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.Object,ChronoIndexDocument>> getMatchingBranchLocalDocuments(ChronoIdentifier chronoIdentifier)
        Queries the indexer state to return all documents that match the given ChronoIdentifier.

        This search does not include origin branches. It only searches directly on the branch indicated by the given identifier.

        Parameters:
        chronoIdentifier - The identifier to get the index documents for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A mapping from indexer name to a map from indexed value to the index document that holds this value. May be empty, but never null.
